title: Woman sticks up for killer after he brutally battered her nephew, 1, to death
text:
Stefanie Nieto, left, does not believe Estabon Alamo, top right, killed her paternal nephew, Serik Nieto, bottom right. (Picture: KESQ/Facebook)

A woman is standing in support of a man convicted of brutally beating her one-year-old nephew to death.

On Monday, Estaban Alamo, 33, was found guilty of killing Serik Nieto in Indio, California.

Alamo, who was dating Serik’s mother, had been babysitting the child for up to five hours while her mother ran errands in October 2010. When the child’s mother returned, she found Serik unresponsive and breathing irregularly with ‘white, foamy saliva’ on his mouth, according to the prosecutors.

The child was taken to Loma Linda University Medical Center where he was pronounced brain-dead. Serik died days later after being taken off life support.

Despite the jury’s decision, Stefanie Nieto, who is the child’s aunt, claimed Alamo is innocent based on a conversation said she had with the victim’s five-year-old sister.

She told KESQ: ‘I can’t say that we have closure because the truth didn’t come out therefore in my mind justice still hasn’t been served.’

‘I know the baby died because he fell down the stairs. His sister told me. She said she couldn’t say nothing because of her mother, which the mother was the main witness.’

Man 'poured beer in alligator's mouth after trying to get it to bite him'

Stefanie Nieto continued: ‘Eyewitnesses in court are the worst witnesses because they’re allowed to say whatever they want. There is no physical evidence linking this man (Alamo) to this crime.

The child’s father, Serik Nieto Sr, who is Stefanie’s brother has always believed Alamo killed his son, saying in 2011: ‘(Serik Jr) had multiple bruises all over his body, like (when) a man beats up a man.’

In an interview with police three days after Serik Jr was hospitalized, Alamo told investigators that the child came inside from playing and had no injuries except for a cut on his lip. Alamo said he assumed the boy had fallen while outside.

Serik Nieto Sr said he is sure Alamo killed his son because of the injuries on the child. (Picture: Justice for Serik Mathew Nieto Facebook)

In a recording played for the court, Alamo told authorities: ‘I have nothing to hide. I know it looks bad.’

Almo’s lawyers provided two alternative scenarios for how Sarik Jr died, telling the jury that the child could have fallen while playing or that his mother could have caused the injuries.

However, the jury found Alamo guilty after three days of deliberation. He is set to be sentenced on November 22.
description: Estaban Alamo, 33, was found guilty of killing Serik Nieto in Indio, California in October 2010 - but a relative of the child doesn't agree.
